titleStmt.title: Great Western Mining and Manufacturing Company

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Great Western Mining and Manufacturing Company

body.p: Mining Company in Lawrence County, Kentucky. Originated as Peach Orchard Coal Company in 1847. Founded by George Carslisle and R.B. Bowler. Name changed to Great Western Mining and Manufacturing Company in 1856.

ab.bibl:
Henry Scalf, Kentucky's Last Frontier, (Johnson City, TN: Overmountain Press, 1966), p. 203.
George G. Torok, A Guide to Historic Coal Towns of the Big Sandy River Valley (Knoxville, University of Tennessee Press, 2004), p. 171-172.
"GREAT WESTERN MINING & MANUFACTURING COMPANY v. CHARLES A. HARRIS" in The Supreme Court Reporter: Cases Argued and Determined in the United States Supreme Court, October Term, 1904 v. 25 (St. Paul: West Publishing Company, 1905), p. 770.
